{"step_by_step_thinking": "High copper amalgam is a dental filling material that is used to fill cavities. It is known for its durability and strength. However, it is also known to undergo various types of corrosion. Electrochemical corrosion occurs due to the presence of different metals in the amalgam that react with saliva. Chemical corrosion occurs due to the reaction of the amalgam with the chemicals present in the mouth. Penetrating corrosion is a type of corrosion that occurs when the amalgam is exposed to a corrosive environment for a long period of time. However, it is not accurate to say that corrosion does not occur at all in high copper amalgam.", "answer_choice": "D"}
